lines.content: > ‚ÄúYour mind is for having ideas, not holding them.‚Äù ‚Äì David Allen ([source](https://boulderbugle.com/quotes-185mla85))
DukePro frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It's,
All you need to do is,
4. let it manage your tasks for you üòâ
If you are a Java programmer, you can use it to practise Java too. Here's the `main` method:

* @params storage Storage object that houses database of the program.

super("‚òπ OOPS!!! The description of a " + taskType + " cannot be empty.");
* A class that represents all exceptions thrown when user is trying to access tasks in the program,
* but provided index is out of bounds.
super("‚òπ OOPS!!! Index provided is invalid.");
* A class that represents all exceptions thrown by the program when
* dates provided when adding tasks is of the wrong format.
super("‚òπ OOPS!!! Date format given is invalid. Please input date in the following format: yyyy-mm-dd");
* A class that represents all exceptions thrown by the program when user wants to add
* a Deadline object but did not provide a date to denote the deadline.
super("‚òπ OOPS!!! Deadline is required for task to be created. Denote deadline with a /by.");
* A class that represents all exceptions thrown by the program when user wants to add an Event
* object but did not input an end date.
super("‚òπ OOPS!!! end time is required for task to be created. Denote end time with a /to.");
* A class that represents all exceptions thrown by the program when information is expected
* in accordance to user commands, but not provided.
public abstract class MissingInformationException extends DukeException {
